Python Beginners

8-Week Python Course Outline

Week 1: Introduction to Python and Programming Basics

  • What is programming?
  • Setting up Python (installing and using Python IDEs)
  • Writing your first Python code: "Hello, World!"
  • Basic concepts: variables, input/output, and simple arithmetic
  • Mini-project: Create a personalized greeting program

Week 2: Understanding Data Types and Operations

  • Exploring data types: integers, floats, strings, and booleans
  • Working with operators (arithmetic, comparison, and logical)
  • String manipulation basics
  • Mini-project: Build a fun math quiz game

Week 3: Control Flow with Conditional Statements

  • If, elif, and else statements
  • Understanding and applying logical operators
  • Mini-project: Create a simple "Guess the Number" game

Week 4: Looping Fun – For and While Loops

  • How and when to use for and while loops
  • Nested loops and loop control (break, continue)
  • Mini-project: Design a simple countdown timer or number guessing game

Week 5: Functions – Reusable Code

  • Why use functions?
  • Writing and calling functions
  • Parameters and return values
  • Mini-project: Create a calculator using functions

Week 6: Working with Lists and Dictionaries

  • Introduction to lists and dictionaries
  • Accessing, modifying, and iterating through data structures
  • Mini-project: Build a mini shopping cart program

Week 7: Simple Game Development

  • Understanding game loops and player input
  • Using Python's random module for unpredictability
  • Mini-project: Create a simple Rock-Paper-Scissors game

Week 8: Capstone Project

  • Plan and create your own small Python project
  • Example projects:
    • A basic text-based adventure game
    • A simple quiz program
    • A mini calculator or interactive story
  • Presentation of projects and celebration!
